DataElement.preferredName: Bladder Malignant Neoplasm Prior Papillary Carcinoma Diagnosis Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a numeric value counting occurrence in the past when tumor was identified characterized by finger-like projections of fibrous stroma covered by neoplastic epithelial cells in the organ storing urine.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bladder Malignant Neoplasm Prior Papillary Carcinoma Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to identification in the past of malignant tumor characterized by finger-like projections of fibrous stroma covered by a layer of neoplastic epithelial cells in the organ which stores urine.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A distensible musculomembranous organ serving as a receptacle for fluid, as the gallbladder.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A malignant neoplasm characterized by the formation of numerous, irregular, finger-like projections of fibrous stroma that is covered with a surface layer of neoplastic epithelial cells. (Stedman, 25th ed):The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm characterized by a papillary growth pattern. A papillary carcinoma may be composed of glandular cells (papillary adenocarcinoma), squamous cells (papillary squamous cell carcinoma), or transitional cells (papillary transitional cell carcinoma). Bladder carcinoma is a representative example of papillary transitional cell carcinoma.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The quantity of the specified item.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.
